result.execSummary:
The defendant Damon C Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater, Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the complaint, property or families
No contact with co-defendant Israel Littleton
No conduct with persons who use/sell controlled substances 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia  
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional

25% of earned wages is to be used for restitution
Restitution joint and several with Israel Littleton  14CF755

If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
